anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch70364 [Kyougoku Daijirou] is the 15th generation owner of the Kyoto sweets shop Amashoudou. One day, Daijirou discovers a giant robot named Doamaiger D in his store`s basement. At the same time, enemies called "Mekaijuu" appear in Kyoto and begin wreaking havoc. Source: ANN

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 決めろ! 京菓子の名前!
Decide! The Name of a Kyoto Pastry!
Kimero! Kyou Kashi no Namae!
episode.summary: A mechalossus interrupts Daijirou and his customer while they`re trying to name a new tea ceremony sweet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見せろ! 巨大製菓機人の力!
Let`s Show `Em! The Power of the Giant Master Confectioner!
Misero! Kyodai Seikakijin no Chikara!
episode.summary: It`s so hot this midsummer that a citizen turns mechalossus out of frustration. Can Daijirou find a treat that`ll help her beat the heat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あけろ! 隠されし歴史の扉!
Open It! The Door to a Hidden History!
Akero! Kakusa Reshi Rekishi no Tobira!
episode.summary: We take a trip back to where it all began, when Daijirou first discovered the mysterious robot Doamayger-D. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 和ませろ! 荒れた心に桜餅!
Be at Peace! Sakura Mochi for a Stormy Heart!
Nagoma Sero! Areta Kokoro ni Sakura Mochi!
episode.summary: Bad weather in Kyoto triggers a frustrated human`s transformation into a mechalossus. Luckily, Doamayger-D is there to save the day! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: PV 01 (30 sec)
受けて立て! アメリカからの刺客!
Accept the Challenge! The Assassin from America!
Ukete Tate! America kara no Shikaku!
episode.summary: A strange American arrives in Kyoto with a robot he claims can beat Doamayger-D! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暴け! 吹き矢男の正体!
Exposed! The Dart Gun Man`s True Identity!
Abake! Fukiya Otoko no Shoutai!
episode.summary: The mysterious man with the dart gun comes back, and Daijirou can hardly believe who he turns out to be. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 切り分けろ! 京の都で水ようかん!
Slice It! Mizuyoukan in Kyoto!
Kiriwakero! Kyou no Miyako de Mizuyoukan!
episode.summary: Tourists sure are hard to please! This time, sightseeing frustrations turn three of them into mechalossi all at once. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 響け! 伝統の木型!
Resonate! The Traditional Kigata!
Hibike! Dentou no Kigata!
episode.summary: Rain causes another tourist to get upset and turn mechalossus, but Daijirou has just the sweet for the job. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紐解け! ドアマイガーD誕生秘話!
Untie the Scroll! The Secret Story of Doamayger-D`s Creation!
Himotoke! Doamaiger D Tanjou Hiwa!
episode.summary: Where did Doamayger-D come from? Who built it, and why? A letter from Gramps reveals all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出し切れ! さらばドアマイガー
Give It Your All! Farewell, Doamayger!
Dashikire! Saraba Doamaiger
episode.summary: In the final episode of Doamayger-D, it`s time for an all-out robot battle for the future of Kyoto confectionery. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 手を取り合え! 親子の絆!
Hand in Hand! The Bond Between Father and Son!
Te o Toriae! Oyako no Kizuna!
episode.summary: It`s time for Daijirou to prove to his father what he`s learned during his time at Kanshoudou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心してかかれ! 最強の敵!
Approach with Caution! The Strongest Foe!
Kokoroshite Kakare! Saikyou no Teki!
episode.summary: After pleasing a distraught customer, Daijirou finds the right words to explain his philosophy to Mr. Robert. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝承せよ! 封印の真実!
Transmit! The Truth of the Seal!
Denshou Seyo! Fuuin no Shinjitsu!
episode.summary: Daijirou discovers why Doamayger-D was sealed away years ago. Source: crunchyroll
